instructions: Go to Settings > Screen Time. Tap See All Activity, then do any of the following: Tap Week to see a summary of your weekly use. Tap Day to see a summary of your daily use.

From any Home screen, press the Recent Apps key. Choose from these options: Close active applications: Swipe up on the app you want to close. Switch applications: Tap the application you want to switch to.

From any Home screen, press the Recent Apps key. Choose from these options: Close active applications: Swipe that app's thumbnail to the side. Switch applications: Tap the application you want to switch to.
From the Home screen, tap the Apps icon. Tap Settings . Scroll down to the 'Phone' category and tap Storage . View the available space.

Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 1 1 Open Excel. Click or double-click the Excel app icon, which resembles a green box with a white "X" on it. If you already have a CSV file that you want to import, skip ahead to the next part . Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 2 2 Click . It's in the upper-left side of the Excel window. Doing so opens a blank spreadsheet. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 3 3 Create your contacts sheet headers. You can add a header to your sheet by clicking a cell in the top row and typing in a description. To create your CSV headings, do the following: Type FirstName into cell A1 . Type LastName into cell B1 . Type Phone into cell C1 . Type Email into cell D1 . Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 4 4 Enter each contact's information. Starting in row two, you'll begin entering each contact's first name, last name, phone number, and email address (if applicable) in the A column, B column, C column, and D column respectively. For example, if you have a contact named "John Doe" with the phone number "1234567890" and the email address "doe@gmail.com", you would enter "John" in cell A2 , "Doe" in cell B2 , "1234567890" in cell C2 , and "doe@gmail.com" in cell D2 . Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 5 5 Click . It's in the top-left corner of the Excel window (Windows) or the screen (Mac). A drop-down menu will appear. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 6 6 Click . This is in the File drop-down menu. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 7 7 Save your document as a CSV file. Depending on your operating system, do one of the following: Windows Double-click This PC in the middle of the page, type in a name for your contacts file, click the "Save as type" bar, click CSV UTF-8 (Comma delimited) (*.csv) in the drop-down menu, click the Desktop folder on the left side of the window, and click Save . Mac Click the "On my Mac" button and then enter name for your file at the top, click the "Where" box, click Desktop , click the "Format" drop-down box, click the CSV option, and click Save . Advertisement

Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 8 1 Open the Google Contacts page. Go to https://contacts.google.com/ in your computer's web browser. This will open the Google Contacts page if you're logged in. If you aren't logged into your Google Account, enter your email address and password when prompted. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 9 2 Click . It's on the left side of the page. Several options will appear in the sidebar. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 10 3 Click . This option is below the More button. Doing so opens a pop-up window. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 11 4 Click . It's at the bottom of the list of import options. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 12 5 Click . This is a blue button at the bottom of the pop-up window. A File Explorer (Windows) or Finder (Mac) window will open. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 13 6 Select your CSV file. Go to the location in which you saved the CSV file (e.g., the desktop), then click the CSV file to select it. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 14 7 Click . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. On a Mac, you may click Choose here. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 15 8 Click . This is at the bottom of the window. Doing so imports your CSV file's contacts into your Google Account. The contacts you upload here will be added to your Google Account on all items, including your Android if you're signed into the same Google Account; if so, you don't need to create a vCard file and import it onto your Android unless you want to save the contacts directly to your Android's hard drive. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 16 9 Select the imported contacts' folder. Click the folder with today's date in the left-hand sidebar to view your CSV file's contacts. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 17 10 Click . It's on the left side of the page. Doing so opens a pop-up window with your imported CSV file's contents selected. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 18 11 Check the "vCard (for iOS Contacts)" box. You'll find this at the bottom of the pop-up window. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 19 12 Click . It's a blue button at the bottom of the window. Doing so downloads a vCard file entitled "contacts" onto your computer. This is the vCard file you'll use to import your contacts onto your Android. Advertisement

Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 20 1 Open Google Drive. Go to https://drive.google.com/ in your computer's web browser. This will open your Google Drive page if you're logged into your Google Account. If you aren't logged into your Google Account, enter your email address and password when prompted before you proceed. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 21 2 Click . It's in the upper-left side of the page. A drop-down menu will appear. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 22 3 Click . This is in the drop-down menu. Clicking it opens a File Explorer (Windows) or Finder (Mac) window. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 23 4 Select your vCard file. Go to the download location of the "contacts" vCard file you exported, then click the vCard file once to select it. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 24 5 Click . It's in the bottom-right corner of the window. The vCard file will be uploaded to Google Drive. Again, on a Mac, you may click Choose here. Advertisement

Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 25 1 Open Google Drive on your Android. Tap the Google Drive app icon, which resembles a green, yellow, and blue triangle on a white background. This will open Google Drive for your Android's main Google Account. You can switch to a different account by tapping and then tapping the profile image for the account you want to use. If your Android isn't signed into the Google Account you used on your computer, you can sign in by tapping , tapping your email address, tapping Add account , tapping Google , and entering your account's login information. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 26 2 Find the vCard file. Scroll through the Google Drive contents until you find the vCard file you uploaded from your computer. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 27 3 Long-press the vCard file. Doing so will prompt a drop-down menu to appear after around a second. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 28 4 Tap . It's in the drop-down menu. Google Drive will begin downloading the vCard file into your Android's "Download" folder. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 29 5 Close Google Drive. Press the Home button to do so. Once the vCard file finishes downloading, you're free to import its contents into your Android's Contacts. Advertisement

Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 30 1 Open your Android's Contacts. Tap the Contacts app in your Android's App Drawer. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 31 2 Tap . It's in the upper-right corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear. On some Androids, you'll tap in the upper-left or upper-right corner instead. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 32 3 Tap . You'll find this in the drop-down menu. On a Samsung Galaxy, you'll instead tap Manage contacts here. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 33 4 Tap . It's on the Settings page. Doing so opens a list of import options. [1] On a Samsung Galaxy, you'll tap Import/Export contacts . Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 34 5 Select the vCard format. Tap the .vcf or vCard option on the Import page. Doing so will open a File Manager window. On a Samsung Galaxy, tap IMPORT near the top of the screen. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 35 6 Select the vCard file. Tap the storage location to which you downloaded the vCard file (e.g., Internal storage ), select the Download folder, and tap the vCard file. On a Samsung Galaxy, selecting the correct storage location will automatically select your vCard file. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 36 7 Select a save location. Tap Phone to save the contacts on your phone, or tap one of the email accounts listed below the Phone options. Image titled Import Contacts from Excel to an Android Phone Step 37 8 Tap . It's at the bottom of the page. Doing so will import your vCard file's contents into your Android's Contacts app. Advertisement
